sent1: " Conservative " means valuing tradition , cultural continuity , and cautious change , not opposing progress but preserving societal essence through respect for established ways .
sent2: What do we mean by the term " conservative” ? The word itself has become so politically charged that it is almost useless to use , but it’s worth thinking about what we actually mean when we say someone is a conservative . I think we should understand being a conservative as being a person who believes in and seeks to preserve the traditional ways of living of his society . This may be thought of as a kind of instinctive attachment to one’s culture . Conservatives are not necessarily against change , but they tend to distrust radical changes and seek to preserve those things that make up the essence of their culture .

sent1: Alaska’s wild , rugged beauty attracts self - reliant souls seeking solitude , hard work , and freedom from society—drawing pioneers , gold seekers , and dreamers for generations .
sent2: Certain kinds of people have always been drawn to the wilds of Alaska . The kind who want to live a rugged , self - reliant existence . The kind that are willing to work hard for what they need to survive . And the kind who don’t mind being away from society and civilization for long stretches of time . There’s something about the vast wilderness that is undeniably alluring to certain types . It was the reason for the Klondike gold rush in the late 1800 s . It was the reason why homesteaders moved there in droves in the early 20th century . And it’s the reason why a lot of people still move there today .

sent1: In the 1970 s , clams in Delaware Bay developed a stiffening illness . Now , scientists find this cancer has spread for over 200 years , possibly due to a virus carried by sea birds .

And , according to new research published today ( April 24 ) in the journal Nature , the disease may be caused by a virus carried by sea birds .

sent1: A Mexican surveillance report reveals top figures , including a presidential candidate and Slim’s son , were monitored from 2011 – 2016 , exposing government and U.S. espionage , despite denials , based on Snowden leaks .
sent2: A leading presidential candidate , a former foreign minister and the son of the Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim were among scores of people whose names turned up in surveillance orders from 2011 to 2016 , according to a report by an independent panel of experts . The document is a snapshot of a world where powerful politicians , business leaders and criminal organizations routinely spy on one another , with the help of the Mexican government , which itself was subjected to American espionage . It provides details about a surveillance program that the Mexican government has long denied existed but that was detailed last year in documents leaked by Edward J. Snowden , the former contractor for the National Security Agency . The 48 - page report , released late Friday night , showed that the

sent1: Indiana’s plan to draw 16 million gallons daily from Lake Michigan angered its most populous county , sparking immediate protest .
sent2: When Indiana officials announced plans to pump 16 million gallons of water a day from Lake Michigan , the state 's most populous county immediately cried foul .

sent1: At 80 , Byron Wien listed his " ten surprises , " reflecting on life 's unexpected turns with wisdom and insight .
sent2: At age 80 , Byron Wien wrote a list of what he called his " ten surprises . "

sent1: In a perfect world , Thanksgiving turkey cooks slowly all day . But reality means quick prep , busy schedules , and hungry guests needing dinner on time .
sent2: In a perfect world , you’d have all day to cook your Thanksgiving turkey . You could start it early in the morning , and by 5 or so , the bird would be done and ready for carving . But this isn’t a perfect world—it’s Thanksgiving . And unless you’re hosting the holiday , chances are good that you’ve got other things going on that day . The kids might have an elementary school concert to attend , or you’ve got family coming over , and you don’t want them waiting around until dinner time to eat .

sent1: Modi 's first foreign trip post - re - election included a beach stroll with Maldivian President Solih , followed by talks .
sent2: It started with a visit to the beach . Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi , on his first foreign trip since re - election in May , went for a stroll along one of the white sand beaches of the tropical island nation of Maldives , accompanied by President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih .
